original: Majjhima Nikāya 36
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: The Collection of Middle-Length Discourses

original: Mahāsaccakasutta
analyzed: mahāsaccaka sutta
translated: The Great Discourse on the Auspicious

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Vesālī, in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ sunivattho hoti pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pavisitukāmo.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam su nivatthaḥ hoti patta cīvaram ādāya vesālim piṇḍāya pavisitu kāmo
translated: On that occasion, in the morning, the Buddha had finished dressing and had taken his bowl and robe, intending to enter Vesālī for alms.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṁ kūṭāgārasālā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ yena mahā vanam kūṭāgāra sālā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Just then Saccaka the son of Nigaṇṭha-s daughter was walking and wandering for exercise. He went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.

original: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando saccakaṁ nigaṇṭhaputtaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.🔽Disvāna bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: addasā kho āyasmai ānandaḥ saccakam nigaṇṭha puttam dūratas vā āgacchanta  disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: The Venerable Ānanda saw him coming in the distance.

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, saccako nigaṇṭhaputto āgacchati bhassappavādako paṇḍitavādo sādhusammato bahujanassa.
analyzed: bhante saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha putto āgacchati bhassa ppavādakaḥ paṇḍita vādaḥ sādhu sammataḥ bahu janassa
translated: He said to the Buddha, “Venerable Sir, here comes Saccaka the son of Nigaṇṭha-s daughter. He is a debater who claims to be wise and is considered by many to be a saint.

original: Eso kho, bhante, avaṇṇakāmo buddhassa, avaṇṇakāmo dhammassa, avaṇṇakāmo saṅghassa.
analyzed: eso kho bhante avaṇṇa kāmaḥ buddhassa avaṇṇa kāmaḥ dhammassa avaṇṇa kāmaḥ saṅghassa
translated: He is critical of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā muhuttaṁ nisīdatu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā muhuttam nisīdatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: Please sit down for a while, out of compassion.”

original: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.🔽Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā
analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane  atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā
translated: The Blessed One sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamanta
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigaṇṭha approached the Blessed One. He exchanged greetings with the Blessed One and, after an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, sat down to one side.

original: nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“Santi, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kāyabhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, no cittabhāvanaṁ.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  santi bho gotama eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā kāya bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttāḥ viharanti no citta bhāvana
translated: As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: Phusanti hi te, bho gotama, sārīrikaṁ dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ.🔽Bhūtapubbaṁ, bho gotama, sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambhopi
analyzed: phusanti hi te bho gotama sārīrikam dukkham vedana  bhūta pubba bho gotama sārīrikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambhaḥ api
translated: “Master Gotama, there are some contemplatives & brahmans who abide committed to the practice of bodily and mental composure, but not to the practice of mental development.🔽They experience bodily pain and mental pain.🔽In the past, when I was touched by bodily pain, I was confused, my mind was confused.

original: nāma bhavissati, hadayampi nāma phalissati, uṇhampi lohitaṁ mukhato uggamissati,
analyzed: nāma bhavissati hadayam pi nāma phalissati uṇham pi lohitam mukhataḥ uggamissati
translated: My thighs cramped, my heart pounded, and I vomited hot blood.

original: ummādampi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṁ.
analyzed: ummādam pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepa
translated: I went mad, lost my mind.

original: Tassa kho etaṁ, bho gotama, kāyanvayaṁ cittaṁ hoti, kāyassa vasena vattati.
analyzed: tassa kho eta bho gotama kāya nvayam cittam hoti kāyassa vasena vattati
translated: My mind was dependent on the body, my mind moved along with the body.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Abhāvitattā cittassa.
analyzed: a bhāvita ttā cittassa
translated: Because the mind has not been developed.

original: Santi pana, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā cittabhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, no kāyabhāvanaṁ.🔽Phusanti hi te, bho gotama, cetasikaṁ dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ.
analyzed: santi pana bho gotama eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā citta bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttāḥ viharanti no kāya bhāvanā  phusanti hi te bho gotama cetasikam dukkham vedana
translated: “But, Master Gotama, there are some ascetics and brahmins who say that they abide devoted to developing the mind, not the body.🔽For they experience mental pain and mental pleasure.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bho gotama, cetasikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambhopi
analyzed: bhūta pubba bho gotama cetasikāya dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhassa sato ūrukkhambhaḥ api
translated: In the past, when I was touched by a painful mental feeling,🔽my thighs would become rigid,

original: nāma bhavissati, hadayampi nāma phalissati, uṇhampi lohitaṁ mukhato uggamissati,
analyzed: nāma bhavissati hadayam pi nāma phalissati uṇham pi lohitam mukhataḥ uggamissati
translated: my heart would burst,

original: ummādampi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepaṁ.
analyzed: ummādam pi pāpuṇissati cittakkhepa
translated: and I would go mad and lose my mind.

original: Tassa kho eso, bho gotama, cittanvayo kāyo hoti, cittassa vasena vattati.
analyzed: tassa kho esaḥ bho gotama citta anvayaḥ kāyaḥ hoti cittassa vasena vattati
translated: That body of mine was subject to my mind, it moved about according to my mind.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Abhāvitattā kāyassa.
analyzed: a bhāvita ttā kāyassa
translated: Because the body has not been developed.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bho gotama, evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa bho gotama evam hoti
translated: “Master Gotama, I think thus:

original: ‘addhā bhoto gotamassa sāvakā cittabhāvanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, no kāyabhāvanan’”ti.
analyzed: addhā bhotaḥ gotamassa sāvakā citta bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttāḥ viharanti no kāya bhāvananti
translated: Surely Master Gotama’s disciples abide devoted to developing the mind, not the body.”

original: “Kinti pana te, aggivessana, kāyabhāvanā sutā”ti?
analyzed: kinti pana te aggivessana kāya bhāvanā sutā ati
translated: “But, Aggivessana, what have you heard about the development of the body?”

original: “Seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: seyyathida
translated: “That is to say,

original: nando vaccho, kiso saṅkicco, makkhali gosālo—🔽etehi, bho gotama, acelakā muttācārā hatthāpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṁ na uddissakataṁ na nimantanaṁ sādiyanti,🔽te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakamantaraṁ na
analyzed: nandaḥ vacchaḥ kisaḥ saṅkiccaḥ makkhali gosālaḥ  etehi bho gotama acelakāḥ mutta ācārāḥ hattha apalekhanāḥ na ehibhaddantikāḥ na tiṭṭhabhaddantikāḥ na abhihaṭam na uddissakatam na nimantanam sādiyanti  te na kumbhi mukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopi mukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam antaram na
translated: Nanda Vaccha, Kisa Saṅkicca, and Makkhali Gosāla.

original: daṇḍamantaraṁ na musalamantaraṁ na dvinnaṁ bhuñjamānānaṁ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya
analyzed: daṇḍam antaram na musalam antaram na dvinnam bhuñjamānānam na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya
translated: They don’t accept food from a dish, from a bowl, across a threshold, across a stick, across a pestle, from two people eating together, from a pregnant woman, from a breastfeeding woman,

original: na purisantaragatāya na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā🔽saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṁ na maṁsaṁ na suraṁ na merayaṁ na thusodakaṁ pivanti.
analyzed: na purisa antara gatāya na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhitaḥ hoti na yattha makkhikā  na maccham na masam na suram na merayam na thusa udakam pivanti
translated: from a man and a woman eating together, from where a dog is waiting to be given food, from where flies are buzzing,🔽from fish, from meat, from strong drink, from wines, from fermented liquors, or from spirits.

original: Te ekāgārikā vā honti ekālopikā, dvāgārikā vā honti dvālopikā …pe… sattāgārikā vā honti sattālopikā.
analyzed: te eka agārikāḥ vā honti ekālopikāḥ dvāgārikāḥ vā honti dvālopikā pe satta āgārikāḥ vā honti satta ālopikā
translated: They eat one house apart, two houses apart … seven houses apart.

original: Ekissāpi dattiyā yāpenti, dvīhipi dattīhi yāpenti …pe… sattahipi dattīhi yāpenti.
analyzed: ekissā api dattiyā yāpenti dvīhi pi dattīhi yāpenti pe sattahi pi dattīhi yāpenti
translated: They live on one meal a day, on two meals a day, on three, four, five, six, or seven meals a day.

original: Ekāhikampi āhāraṁ āhārenti, dvīhikampi āhāraṁ āhārenti …pe… sattāhikampi āhāraṁ āhārenti. Iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyuttā viharantī”ti.
analyzed: ekāhikam pi āhāram āhārenti dvīhikam pi āhāram āhārenti pe sattāhikam pi āhāram āhārenti iti evarūpam addhamāsikam pi pariyāya bhatta bhojana anuyogam anuyuttāḥ viharanti iti
translated: They eat once a day, once every two days, once every three, four, five, six, or seven days. In this way they even go a fortnight or a month between meals.”

original: “Kiṁ pana te, aggivessana, tāvatakeneva yāpentī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana te aggivessana tāvatakena iva yāpenti iti
translated: “But, Aggivessana, do they live on that alone?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama
translated: “No, Master Gotama.

original: Appekadā, bho gotama, uḷārāni uḷārāni khādanīyāni khādanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni bhojanāni bhuñjanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni sāyanīyāni sāyanti, uḷārāni uḷārāni pānāni pivanti.
analyzed: appekadā bho gotama uḷārāni uḷārāni khādanīyāni khādanti uḷārāni uḷārāni bhojanāni bhuñjanti uḷārāni uḷārāni sāyanīyāni sāyanti uḷārāni uḷārāni pānāni pivanti
translated: Sometimes they eat exquisite delicacies: exquisite rice with exquisite curries, exquisite fish, meat, and fowl, exquisite delicacies from the forest, exquisite delicacies from the village, exquisite delicacies from the sky, and exquisite delicacies from the water.

original: Te imaṁ kāyaṁ balaṁ gāhenti nāma, brūhenti nāma, medenti nāmā”ti.
analyzed: te imam kāyam balam nāma brūhenti nāma medenti nāma ati
translated: They make this body strong, they say, and they make it supple and light.”

original: “Yaṁ kho te, aggivessana, purimaṁ pahāya pacchā upacinanti, evaṁ imassa kāyassa ācayāpacayo hoti.
analyzed: yam kho te aggivessana purimam pahāya pacchā upacinanti evam imassa kāyassa ācaya apacayaḥ hoti
translated: “Aggivessana, when they give up the former and accumulate the latter, that is how there is increase and decrease in this body.

original: Kinti pana te, aggivessana, cittabhāvanā sutā”ti?
analyzed: kinti pana te aggivessana citta bhāvanā sutā ati
translated: But, Aggivessana, have you heard where mind-development has been taught?”

original: Cittabhāvanāya kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā puṭṭho samāno na sampāyāsi.
analyzed: citta bhāvanāya kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na
translated: When Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha was asked by the Fortunate One about the development of mind, he was unable to cope (with the question).

original: Atha kho bhagavā saccakaṁ nigaṇṭhaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā saccakam nigaṇṭha puttam etat avoca
translated: Then the Fortunate One said this to Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha:

original: “yāpi kho te esā, aggivessana, purimā kāyabhāvanā bhāsitā sāpi ariyassa vinaye no dhammikā kāyabhāvanā.
analyzed: yā api kho te esā aggivessana purimā kāya bhāvanā bhāsitā sā api ariyassa vinaye no dhammikā kāya bhāvanā
translated: “But, Aggivessana, this development of the body that you spoke of is not a Dhamma-follower’s development of the body in the Noble One’s Discipline.

original: Kāyabhāvanampi kho tvaṁ, aggivessana, na aññāsi, kuto pana tvaṁ cittabhāvanaṁ jānissasi?🔽Api ca, aggivessana, yathā abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto ca.
analyzed: kāya bhāvanam pi kho tva aggivessana na aññāsi kutas pana tvam citta bhāvanam jānissasi  api ca aggivessana yathā abhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti abhāvita citto ca bhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti bhāvita citto ca
translated: You do not even know the development of the body, Aggivessana, so how will you know the development of mind?

original: Taṁ suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: But, Aggivessana, listen well, and attend closely, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, reverend Sir,” Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha replied to the Fortunate One.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Fortunate One said this:

original: “Kathañca, aggivessana, abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca?
analyzed: kathañca aggivessana abhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti abhāvita citto ca
translated: “And how, Aggivessana, is there the undeveloped body and the undeveloped mind?

original: Idha, aggivessana, assutavato puthujjanassa uppajjati sukhā vedanā.
analyzed: idha aggivessana assutavataḥ puthujjanassa uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Here, Aggivessana, pleasant feeling arises in the unlearned worldling when touched by a pleasant contact.

original: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno sukhasārāgī ca hoti sukhasārāgitañca āpajjati.
analyzed: saḥ sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ sukha sārāgī ca hoti sukha sārāgi tañca āpajjati
translated: Being touched by a pleasant contact, he delights in that pleasant feeling, he welcomes it, and remains cleaving to it.

original: Tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati.
analyzed: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati
translated: Then that pleasant feeling of his ceases.

original: Sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: With the cessation of pleasant feeling, painful feeling arises.

original: So dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṁ kandati sammohaṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ socati kilamati paridevati uras tāḷim kandati sammoham āpajjati
translated: Being touched by painful feeling, he sorrows, grieves and laments, he weeps beating his breast and becomes distraught.

original: Tassa kho esā, aggivessana, uppannāpi sukhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannāpi dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā cittassa.
analyzed: tassa kho esā aggivessana uppannā api sukhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭhati a bhāvita ttā kāyassa uppannā api dukkhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭhati a bhāvita ttā cittassa
translated: Thus, Aggivessana, even pleasant feeling that has arisen in him keeps his mind occupied in so far as it has not been developed in the past, and even painful feeling that has arisen in him keeps his mind occupied in so far as it has not been developed in the mind.

original: Yassa kassaci, aggivessana, evaṁ ubhatopakkhaṁ uppannāpi sukhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya
analyzed: yassa kassaci aggivessana evam ubhatopakkham uppannā api sukhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya
translated: Whoever has not developed his body and mind in this way, Aggivessana, will have his mind occupied by pleasant feeling that has arisen,

original: tiṭṭhati abhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannāpi dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
analyzed: tiṭṭhati abhāvita ttā kāyassa uppannā api dukkhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: and by painful feeling that has arisen.

original: abhāvitattā cittassa, evaṁ kho, aggivessana, abhāvitakāyo ca hoti abhāvitacitto ca.
analyzed: a bhāvita ttā cittassa evam kho aggivessana abhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti abhāvita citto ca
translated: because his mind is undeveloped. That is how there is an undeveloped body and an undeveloped mind.

original: Kathañca, aggivessana, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto ca?
analyzed: kathañca aggivessana bhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti bhāvita citto ca
translated: And how is there a developed body and a developed mind?

original: Idha, aggivessana, sutavato ariyasāvakassa uppajjati sukhā vedanā.
analyzed: idha aggivessana sutavataḥ ariya sāvakassa uppajjati sukhā vedanā
translated: Here, Aggivessana, a well-taught noble disciple, who has regard for noble ones and is skilled and disciplined in their Dhamma, who has regard for true men and is skilled and disciplined in their Dhamma,

original: So sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno na sukhasārāgī ca hoti, na sukhasārāgitañca āpajjati.
analyzed: saḥ sukhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na sukha sārāgī ca hoti na sukha sārāgi tañca āpajjati
translated: when touched by painful bodily feelings does not sorrow, grieve or lament, does not weep beating his breast and become distraught.

original: Tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati.
analyzed: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati
translated: That painful bodily feeling, being abandoned, ceases;

original: Sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā
translated: and with the cessation of the painful bodily feeling there arises consciousness-born joy.

original: So dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno na socati na kilamati na paridevati na urattāḷiṁ kandati na sammohaṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na socati na kilamati na paridevati na uras tāḷim kandati na sammoham āpajjati
translated: When he is touched by that consciousness-born joy, he does not rejoice at it, he does not welcome it or delight in it.🔽That consciousness-born joy, being abandoned, ceases;

original: Tassa kho esā, aggivessana, uppannāpi sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannāpi dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvitattā cittassa.
analyzed: tassa kho esā aggivessana uppannā api sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvita ttā kāyassa uppannā api dukkhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati bhāvita ttā cittassa
translated: and with the cessation of the consciousness-born joy there arises bodily happiness.

original: Yassa kassaci, aggivessana, evaṁ ubhatopakkhaṁ uppannāpi sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya
analyzed: yassa kassaci aggivessana evam ubhatopakkham uppannā api sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya
translated: For anyone who has developed the body and developed the mind, pleasant feeling that arises does not persist,

original: tiṭṭhati bhāvitattā kāyassa, uppannāpi dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
analyzed: tiṭṭhati bhāvita ttā kāyassa uppannā api dukkhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: and painful feeling that arises does not persist.

original: bhāvitattā cittassa. Evaṁ kho, aggivessana, bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto cā”ti.
analyzed: bhāvita ttā cittassa evam kho aggivessana bhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti bhāvita citto ca ati
translated: It is in this way that one is developed in body and developed in mind.”

original: “Evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ bhoto gotamassa.
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ aham bhoto gotamassa
translated: “I am satisfied with what I have heard from Master Gotama.

original: Bhavañhi gotamo bhāvitakāyo ca hoti bhāvitacitto cā”ti.
analyzed: bhavan hi gotamaḥ bhāvita kāyaḥ ca hoti bhāvita cittaḥ ca ati
translated: Master Gotama is developed in body and developed in mind.”

original: “Addhā kho te ayaṁ, aggivessana, āsajja upanīya vācā bhāsitā,
analyzed: addhā kho te aya aggivessana āsajjaḥ upanīya vācā bhāsitā
translated: “Surely, Aggivessana, you have spoken with reference to me,

original: api ca te ahaṁ byākarissāmi.
analyzed: api ca te aham byākarissāmi
translated: but still I will answer you.

original: Yato kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā🔽anagāriyaṁ pabbajito, taṁ vata me uppannā vā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya ṭhassati,
analyzed: yatas kho aha aggivessana kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā  anagāriyam pabbajito tam vata me uppannā vā sukhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya ṭhassati
translated: Since I shaved off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and went forth from the home life into homelessness,🔽it is not possible that pleasant feeling that has arisen might persist,

original: uppannā vā dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya ṭhassatīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: uppannā vā dukkhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya ṭhassati iti na etam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: or that painful feeling that has arisen might persist.”

original: “Na hi nūna bhoto gotamassa uppajjati tathārūpā sukhā vedanā yathārūpā uppannā sukhā🔽vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya; na hi nūna bhoto gotamassa uppajjati tathārūpā
analyzed: na hi nūna bhoto gotamassa uppajjati tathārūpā sukhā vedanā yathārūpā uppannā sukhā  vedanā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya na hi nūna bhoto gotamassa uppajjati tathārūpā
translated: “Surely, Master Gotama, you don’t experience any pleasant feeling that, having arisen, would persist?”

original: dukkhā vedanā yathārūpā uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭheyyā”ti.
analyzed: dukkhā vedanā yathārūpā uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittam pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Surely, Master Gotama, you don’t experience any painful feeling that, having arisen, would persist?”

original: “Kiñhi no siyā, aggivessana?
analyzed: kim hi naḥ siyā aggivessana
translated: “How could it be otherwise, Aggivessana?

original: Idha me, aggivessana, pubbeva sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
analyzed: idha me aggivessana pubbā iva sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: Before my enlightenment, while I was still only an unenlightened Bodhisatta, I too thought:

original: ‘sambādho gharāvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā.🔽Nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: sambādhaḥ gharāvāsaḥ rajāpathaḥ abbhokāsaḥ pabbajjā  na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: ‘Household life is crowded and dusty; life gone forth is wide open.🔽It is not easy, living in a home, to lead the holy life utterly perfect and pure as a polished shell.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Suppose I shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, aparena samayena daharova samāno, susukāḷakeso bhadrena
analyzed: saḥ khalu aha aggivessana aparena samayena daharaḥ uva samānaḥ su su kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena
translated: Then, Aggivessana, after some time, when I was still young, with black hair, endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life,

original: yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā, akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ,
analyzed: yobbanena samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam
translated: Then, Aggivessana, after some time, being still young, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though my mother and father wished otherwise, weeping and in tears,

original: kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajiṁ.
analyzed: kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbaji
translated: I shaved off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and went forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Having gone forth thus, seeking what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I approached Āḷāra Kālāma and said to him:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, āvuso kālāma, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṁ caritun’ti.
analyzed: icchāmahe āvuso kālāma imasmin dhamma vinaye brahmacariyam caritun ti
translated: ‘It is my wish, friend Kālāma, to lead the holy life in this Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo maṁ etadavoca:🔽‘viharatāyasmā,
analyzed: evam vutte aggivessanaḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ mam etat avoca  viharata ayasmai
translated: When this was said, Aggivessana, Āḷāra Kālāma replied:🔽‘Let the venerable one dwell heedful, ardent, and resolute for seven days.

original: tādiso ayaṁ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirasseva sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā’ti.
analyzed: tādisaḥ ayam dhammaḥ yattha viññū purisaḥ nacirassa iva sakam ācariyakam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya ati
translated: For it is possible that the venerable one, dwelling heedful, ardent, and resolute for seven days, might realize a superhuman state, a distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam pariyāpuṇi
translated: And in no long time I too had mastered that Dhamma.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, tāvatakeneva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañca vadāmi theravādañca, ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañceva aññe ca.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana tāvatakena iva oṭṭha pahata mattena lapita lāpana mattena ñāṇa vādañca vadāmi thera vādañca jānāmi passāmi iti ca paṭijānāmi aham ca iva aññe ca
translated: And I too, Aggivessana, with just that much as I had learned by heart, with that much as I had recited, with that much as I had inquired into, with that much as I had investigated with wisdom, I too claimed to know and see, and I too claimed to have arrived at this firm ground, and I too claimed to have reached the state of completion, and I too claimed to be consummate, and I too claimed to be a Teacher Consummate One, and I too claimed to be one who had overcome all doubts and uncertainties, and I too claimed to have attained to that Asaṃkhata where there is no birth, no ageing, no death, no grief, no stain, and I too claimed to be able to proclaim to others that Deathless which I had attained.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: And I thought:

original: ‘na kho āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti,
analyzed: na kho āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam kevalam saddhāmattakena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti
translated: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma does not proclaim this Dhamma merely on the basis of hearsay,

original: addhā āḷāro kālāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ viharatī’ti.
analyzed: addhā āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ imam dhammam jānam passam viharati iti
translated: surely he knows and sees this Dhamma himself.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, aggivessana, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atha khvā āha aggivessana yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Then I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and said:

original: ‘kittāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā no āvuso kālāme imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi iti
translated: ‘Friend Kālāma, in what way do you proclaim that you have attained to this Dhamma, that you have directly experienced it and live having contacted it with the body?’

original: Evaṁ vutte, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: evam vutte aggivessanaḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ ākiñcaññāyatanam pavedesi
translated: When this was said, Aggivessana, Alara Kalama proclaimed the base of nothingness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:🔽‘na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi saddhā, mayhampatthi saddhā;🔽na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi vīriyaṁ, mayhampatthi vīriyaṁ;🔽na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi sati, mayhampatthi sati;
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi saddhā mayham patthi saddhā  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi vīriya mayham patthi vīriya  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi sati sati
translated: Then, Aggivessana, I thought:🔽‘Alara Kalama does not have faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom for realising this Dhamma by himself.

original: na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi samādhi, mayhampatthi samādhi;🔽na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi paññā, mayhampatthi paññā;🔽yannūnāhaṁ yaṁ dhammaṁ āḷāro kālāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedeti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyan’ti.
analyzed: na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi samādhi mayham patthi samādhi  na kho āḷārassa iva kālāmassa atthi paññā mayham patthi paññā  yat nūna aham yam dhammaṃ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti paveda iti tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyanti
translated: I have faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom for realising this Dhamma by myself.🔽Why don’t I strive to realise that Dhamma which Alara Kalama proclaims having realised it by himself?”

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: So, Aggivessana, in no long time I soon realised that Dhamma by myself, and directly knew it, and dwelt having known it, having directly experienced it, and having attained it.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, aggivessana, yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavocaṁ:🔽‘ettāvatā no, āvuso kālāma, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: atha khvā āha aggivessana yena āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca  ettāvatā no āvuso kālāma imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti
translated: Then I went to Āḷāra Kālāma and asked him:🔽‘Friend Kālāma, is it the case that by realising for myself with direct knowledge I here and now entered upon and abided in this Dhamma?’

original: ‘Ettāvatā kho ahaṁ, āvuso, imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemī’ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho aha āvuso imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi iti
translated: ‘It is by realising for myself with direct knowledge that I here and now entered upon and abide in this Dhamma.’

original: ‘Ahampi kho, āvuso, ettāvatā imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmī’ti.🔽‘Lābhā no, āvuso, suladdhaṁ no, āvuso,
analyzed: aham pi kho āvuso ettāvatā imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti  lābhāḥ naḥ āvuso su laddham naḥ āvuso
translated: ‘Then, friend, I too by realising for myself with direct knowledge entered upon and abide in this Dhamma.’

original: ye mayaṁ āyasmantaṁ tādisaṁ sabrahmacāriṁ passāma.
analyzed: ye mayam āyasmantam tādisam sabrahmacārim passāma
translated: ‘It is a gain for us, friend, it is a great gain for us that we see such a venerable elder as yourself as a companion in the holy life.

original: Iti yāhaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi;
analyzed: iti yā aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi tam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi
translated: So the Dhamma that I entered upon and abide in having realised for myself with direct knowledge, you too enter upon and abide in having realised for yourself with direct knowledge;

original: yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tamahaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi.
analyzed: yam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi tam aham dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedemi
translated: I have realized this Dhamma for myself and I have attained it, and I live, having known and experienced it for myself.

original: Iti yāhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi; yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi tamahaṁ dhammaṁ jānāmi.
analyzed: iti yā aham dhammam jānāmi tam tvam dhammam jānāsi yam tvam dhammam jānāsi tam aham dhammam jānāmi
translated: I know the Dhamma that you know, and you know the Dhamma that I know.

original: Iti yādiso ahaṁ tādiso tuvaṁ, yādiso tuvaṁ tādiso ahaṁ.
analyzed: iti yādisaḥ aham tādisaḥ yādisaḥ tuvam tādisaḥ aha
translated: I am like you, and you are like me.

original: Ehi dāni, āvuso, ubhova santā imaṁ gaṇaṁ pariharāmā’ti.
analyzed: ehi dāni āvuso ubhova santāḥ imam gaṇam pariharāma ati
translated: Come, friend, let us now look after this community together.’

original: Iti kho, aggivessana, āḷāro kālāmo ācariyo me samāno attano antevāsiṁ maṁ samānaṁ attanā samasamaṁ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṁ pūjāya pūjesi.
analyzed: iti kho aggivessanaḥ āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ ācariyaḥ me samānaḥ attanaḥ antevāsim mam samānam attanā samasamam ṭhapesi uḷārāya ca mam pūjāya pūjesi
translated: So, Aggivessana, my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma, while instructing me, placed me on the same level as himself, and he honored me with lofty praise.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: But it occurred to me:

original: ‘nāyaṁ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati, yāvadeva ākiñcaññāyatanūpapattiyā’ti.
analyzed: na ayam dhammaḥ nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati yāvat eva ākiñcaññāyatana upapattiyā ati
translated: ‘This Dhamma does not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbāna, but only to reappearance in the base of nothingness.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, taṁ dhammaṁ analaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkamiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana tam dhammam an alaṅkaritvā tasmā dhammā nibbijja apakkami
translated: But I did not delight in that Dhamma, and after a short time I left.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana kiṅkusala gavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ yena udakaḥ rāmaputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā udakam rāmaputtam etat avoca
translated: Searching for what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, I went to Uddaka Ramaputta and said:

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, āvuso, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṁ caritun’ti.
analyzed: icchāmahe āvuso imasmin dhamma vinaye brahmacariyam caritum ti
translated: ‘Friend, I want to lead the spiritual life in this Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, aggivessana, udako rāmaputto maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte aggivessanaḥ udakaḥ rāma putto mam etat avoca
translated: When I had spoken, he said:

original: ‘viharatāyasmā,🔽tādiso ayaṁ dhammo yattha viññū puriso nacirasseva sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyā’ti.
analyzed: viharata ayasmai  tādisaḥ ayam dhammaḥ yattha viññū purisaḥ nacirassa iva sakam ācariyakam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyya ati
translated: ‘The venerable one may stay here.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam pariyāpuṇi
translated: This Dhamma is such that a wise man can soon realise for himself by direct knowledge the highest goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.’🔽So soon, so quickly did I learn that Dhamma that I said to Uddaka Ramaputta:

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, tāvatakeneva oṭṭhapahatamattena lapitalāpanamattena ñāṇavādañca vadāmi theravādañca, ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti ca paṭijānāmi, ahañceva aññe ca.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana tāvatakena iva oṭṭha pahata mattena lapita lāpana mattena ñāṇa vādañca vadāmi thera vādañca jānāmi passāmi iti ca paṭijānāmi aham ca iva aññe ca
translated: And so, Aggivessana, I claimed to have knowledge and insight, and I claimed to have attained the highest goal of the spiritual life, merely on the basis of this limited understanding, this limited knowledge.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: I thought:

original: ‘na kho rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ kevalaṁ saddhāmattakena sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesi.
analyzed: na kho rāmaḥ imam dhammam kevalam saddhāmattakena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi
translated: ‘Rāma did not declare that he had attained this Dhamma merely through faith.

original: Addhā rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ jānaṁ passaṁ vihāsī’ti.
analyzed: addhā rāmaḥ imam dhammam jānam passam vihāsi iti
translated: Surely he must have known and seen this Dhamma himself.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, aggivessana, yena udako rāmaputto tenupasaṅkamiṁ; upasaṅkamitvā udakaṁ rāmaputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:🔽‘kittāvatā no āvuso rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesī’ti?
analyzed: atha khvā āha aggivessana yena udakaḥ rāma putto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā udakam rāma puttam etat avoca  kittāvatā no āvuso rāmaḥ imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi iti
translated: So I went to him and asked:🔽‘Rāma, in what way did you declare that you had attained this Dhamma?’

original: Evaṁ vutte, aggivessana, udako rāmaputto nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ pavedesi.
analyzed: evam vutte aggivessanaḥ udakaḥ rāma putto nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam pavedesi

analyzed: na kho rāmassa iva ahosi paññā mayham patthi paññā
translated: Rāma had wisdom, but I have wisdom;

original: yannūnāhaṁ yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmīti pavedesi tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yam dhammam rāmo sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti pavedesi tassa dhammassa sacchikiriyāya padaheyyanti
translated: why don’t I strive for the realization of that Dhamma which Rāma proclaimed after attaining it for himself?’🔽And, Aggivessana, in no long time—fast, I say—

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, nacirasseva khippameva taṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana nacirassa iva khippam eva tam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: I attained that Dhamma, and lived having known, experienced, and attained it myself.

translated: ‘Friend, is this as far as the Dhamma you have attained extends, or does it go further?’

original: ‘Ettāvatā kho āvuso rāmo imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesī’ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho āvuso rāmaḥ imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi iti
translated: ‘It is in this way that Rāma has awakened to this Dhamma and made it known to you.’

original: ‘Ahampi kho, āvuso, ettāvatā imaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmī’ti.
analyzed: aham pi kho āvuso ettāvatā imam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi iti
translated: ‘I too have awakened to this Dhamma and am living in it.’

original: ‘Lābhā no, āvuso, suladdhaṁ no, āvuso,
analyzed: lābhāḥ naḥ āvuso su laddham naḥ āvuso
translated: ‘It is a great gain for us, friend, it is a great blessing for us,

original: ye mayaṁ āyasmantaṁ tādisaṁ sabrahmacāriṁ passāma.
analyzed: ye mayam āyasmantam tādisam sabrahmacārim passāma
translated: that we see a companion in the holy life like you.

original: Iti yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi, taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: iti yam dhammam rāmaḥ sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi tam tvam dhamma
translated: So the Dhamma that Rāma awakened to and made known to you,

original: sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi; yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā
analyzed: sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharasi yam tvam dhammam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā
translated: you have awakened to and are living in.

original: upasampajja viharasi, taṁ dhammaṁ rāmo sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi.
analyzed: upasampajja viharasi tam dhammam rāmo sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja pavedesi
translated: And the Dhamma that you have awakened to and are living in, Rāma awakened to and made known to you.🔽So you know the Dhamma that Rāma knew,

original: Iti yaṁ dhammaṁ rāmo abhiññāsi taṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi; yaṁ tvaṁ dhammaṁ jānāsi taṁ dhammaṁ rāmo abhiññāsi.
analyzed: iti yam dhammam rāmaḥ abhiññāsi tam tvam dhammam jānāsi yam tvam dhammam jānāsi tam dhammam rāmaḥ abhiññāsi
translated: and Rāma knew the Dhamma that you know.

original: Iti yādiso rāmo ahosi tādiso tuvaṁ; yādiso tuvaṁ tādiso rāmo ahosi.
analyzed: iti yādisaḥ rāmaḥ ahosi tādisaḥ yādisaḥ tuvam tādisaḥ rāmaḥ ahosi
translated: So you are like Rāma, and Rāma was like you.

original: Ehi dāni, āvuso, tuvaṁ imaṁ gaṇaṁ pariharā’ti.
analyzed: ehi dāni āvuso tuvam imam gaṇam parihara
translated: Come now, friend, take over this community.’

original: Iti kho, aggivessana, udako rāmaputto sabrahmacārī me samāno ācariyaṭṭhāne ca maṁ ṭhapesi, uḷārāya ca maṁ pūjāya pūjesi.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:

translated: But, Aggivessana, I thought:

translated: So, dissatisfied with that Dhamma, I left.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaraṁ santivarapadaṁ pariyesamāno magadhesu anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena uruvelā senānigamo tadavasariṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana kiṅkusalagavesī anuttaram santivara padam pariyesamānaḥ magadhesu anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena uruvelā senānigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: Now, Aggivessana, in search of what is wholesome, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace, wandering by stages in Magadha, I eventually arrived at the town of Senāni.

original: Tatthaddasaṁ ramaṇīyaṁ bhūmibhāgaṁ, pāsādikañca vanasaṇḍaṁ, nadiñca sandantiṁ setakaṁ supatitthaṁ ramaṇīyaṁ, samantā ca gocaragāmaṁ.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:

translated: I thought:

original: ‘ramaṇīyo vata bho bhūmibhāgo, pāsādiko ca vanasaṇḍo, nadī ca sandati setakā supatitthā ramaṇīyā, samantā ca gocaragāmo.
analyzed: ramaṇīyaḥ vata bho bhūmi bhāgaḥ pāsādikaḥ ca vana saṇḍaḥ nadī ca sandati setakā su patitthā ramaṇīyā samantā ca gocara gāmaḥ

original: kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho, so ca ajjhattaṁ suppahīno hoti suppaṭippassaddho, opakkamikā
analyzed: kāma pipāsā kāma pariḷāho saḥ ca ajjhattam su pahīnaḥ hoti su paṭippassaddhaḥ opakkamikā
translated: still have not abandoned the lust, desire, love, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures that still persist within them.

analyzed: ce pi te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti bhabbāva
translated: Even if such good recluses and brahmins experience painful, racking, piercing feelings due to exertion,🔽they are still incapable of knowledge and vision,

original: te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya. No cepi te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā opakkamikā
analyzed: te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya no ce pi te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ opakkamikā
translated: for the knowledge and vision of the supreme perfect awakening. But if those venerable contemplatives and brahmans are not of right view, right aim, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, right knowledge, right freedom,

original: dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti, bhabbāva te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.🔽Ayaṁ kho maṁ, aggivessana, tatiyā upamā paṭibhāsi anacchariyā pubbe assutapubbā.

translated: for the knowledge and vision of the supreme perfect awakening. Even if those good recluses and brahmins do experience painful, sharp, harsh, and bitter feelings born of over-exertion, they are still capable of the knowledge and vision of the supreme perfect awakening.🔽This, Aggivessana, was the third simile that occurred to me spontaneously, never heard before.

original: Imā kho maṁ, aggivessana, tisso upamā paṭibhaṁsu anacchariyā pubbe assutapubbā.
analyzed: imā kho ma aggivessana tissaḥ upamā anacchariyā pubbe a ssuta pubbā
translated: These, Aggivessana, were the three similes that occurred to me spontaneously, never heard before.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:

translated: Then, Aggivessana, I considered thus:

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ dantebhi dantamādhāya, jivhāya tāluṁ āhacca, cetasā cittaṁ abhiniggaṇheyyaṁ abhinippīḷeyyaṁ abhisantāpeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham dantebhiḥ dantam ādhāya jivhāya tālum cetasā cittam abhiniggaṇheyyam abhinippīḍeyyam abhisantāpeyyanti
translated: ‘Suppose I were to grind my teeth with my teeth and press my tongue against my palate, and restrain, subdue, and totally overcome my mind by my mind.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, dantebhi dantamādhāya, jivhāya tāluṁ āhacca, cetasā cittaṁ abhiniggaṇhāmi abhinippīḷemi abhisantāpemi.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana dantebhi dantam ādhāya jivhāya tālum cetasā cittam abhiniggaṇhāmi abhinippīḍemi abhisantāpemi
translated: So, Aggivessana, I ground my teeth with my teeth and pressed my tongue against my palate, and I restrained, subdued, and totally overcame my mind by my mind.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, dantebhi dantamādhāya jivhāya tāluṁ āhacca cetasā cittaṁ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.
analyzed: tassa aggivessana dantebhi dantam ādhāya jivhāya tālum āhat ca cetasā cittam abhiniggaṇhataḥ abhinippīḍayataḥ abhisantāpayataḥ kacchehi sedāḥ muccanti
translated: I clenched my teeth and pressed my tongue against the roof of my mouth, and I exerted my mind against my mind.

original: Seyyathāpi, aggivessana, balavā puriso dubbalataraṁ purisaṁ sīse vā gahetvā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api aggivessana balavā purisaḥ dubbalataram purisam sīse vā gahetvā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḍeyya abhisantāpeyya
translated: Just as a strong man might seize a weaker man by the head or shoulders and exert his mind against his mind,

original: evameva kho me, aggivessana, dantebhi dantamādhāya, jivhāya tāluṁ āhacca, cetasā cittaṁ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.🔽Āraddhaṁ kho pana me, aggivessana, vīriyaṁ hoti asallīnaṁ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā,
analyzed: evam eva khalu me aggivessana dantebhiḥ dantam ādhāya jivhāya tālum āhat ca cetasā cittam abhiniggaṇhataḥ abhinippīḍayataḥ abhisantāpayataḥ kacchehi sedāḥ muccanti  āraddham kho pana me aggivessana vīriyam hoti a sallīna upaṭṭhitā sati a sammuṭṭhā
translated: so I clenched my teeth and pressed my tongue against the roof of my mouth, and I exerted my mind against my mind.🔽But my body was racked and the sweat poured from my armpits.

original: sāraddho ca pana me kāyo hoti appaṭippassaddho teneva dukkhappadhānena padhānābhitunnassa sato.

translated: Yet I thought: ‘Suppose I were to attain the deathless by a path of suffering? That would not be fitting.’

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: But even such painful feelings do not persist in overpowering my mind.

translated: ‘What if I were to meditate with my nostrils & mouth closed?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāse uparundhiṁ.🔽Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇasotehi vātānaṁ nikkhamantānaṁ adhimatto saddo hoti.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana mukhataḥ ca nāsataḥ ca assāsa passāse uparundhi  tassa mayha aggivessana mukhataḥ ca nāsataḥ ca assāsa passāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇa sotehi vātānam nikkhamantānam adhimattaḥ saddaḥ hoti
translated: So I closed my nostrils & mouth.🔽As I did so, the winds in my head let loose a roar.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma kammāragaggariyā dhamamānāya adhimatto saddo hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma kammāra gaggariyā dhamamānāya adhimattaḥ saddaḥ hoti

analyzed: evam eva kho me aggivessana mukhataḥ ca nāsataḥ ca assāsa passāsesu uparuddhesu kaṇṇa sotehi vātānam nikkhamantānam adhimattaḥ saddaḥ hoti
translated: in the same way, as I closed my nostrils & mouth, the winds in my head let loose a roar.

translated: My energy was aroused and unflagging, my mindfulness was established and alert, and my body was tranquil and undisturbed.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.

translated: But still that painful feeling did not invade my mind and remain.

translated: ‘What if I were to enter the wind-coinciding concentration?’🔽So I stopped the in-breaths and out-breaths through my mouth, nose, and ears.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, mukhato ca nāsato ca kaṇṇato ca assāsapassāsesu uparuddhesu adhimattā vātā muddhani ūhananti.

translated: ‘Suppose I breathe in and out through the pores of my skin? ’🔽So I stopped the in-breaths and out-breaths through my mouth, nose, and ears, and I breathed in and out through the pores of my skin.

translated: Some deities said:
