analyzed: mā kho tva mārisa sabbaso āhāra upacchedāya paṭipajji
translated: ‘Good sir, do not undertake complete abstention from food.

original: Sace kho tvaṁ, mārisa, sabbaso āhārupacchedāya paṭipajjissasi, tassa te mayaṁ dibbaṁ ojaṁ lomakūpehi ajjhohāressāma, tāya tvaṁ yāpessasī’ti.
analyzed: sace kho tva mārisa sabbasas āhāra upacchedāya paṭipajjissasi tassa te mayam dibbam ojam lomakūpehi ajjhohāressāma tāya tvam yāpessasi iti
translated: If you do, we’ll infuse divine nourishment through the pores of your skin, and you’ll be able to live on that.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: ‘ahañceva kho pana sabbaso ajajjitaṁ paṭijāneyyaṁ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṁ ojaṁ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṁ, tāya cāhaṁ yāpeyyaṁ, taṁ mamassa musā’ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana sabbasas a jajjitam paṭijāneyya imāḥ ca me devatāḥ dibbam ojam lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyu tāya ca aham yāpeyya tam mama assa musā ati
translated: ‘If I were to admit to being completely well, and if these deities were to infuse divine nourishment through the pores of my skin, and if I were to live on that, it would be a lie on my part.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, tā devatā paccācikkhāmi, ‘halan’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: so kho aha aggivessana tā devatā paccācikkhāmi halanti vadāmi
translated: So I rejected those deities, saying, ‘No.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: I thought,

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ thokaṁ thokaṁ āhāraṁ āhāreyyaṁ, pasataṁ pasataṁ, yadi vā muggayūsaṁ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṁ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṁ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham thokam thokam āhāram āhāreyya pasatam pasata yadi vā mugga yūsa yadi vā kulattha yūsa yadi vā kaḷāya yūsa yadi vā hareṇuka yūsanti
translated: ‘Why don’t I eat a little food, a half measure, a quarter measure, or even a half-chari measure of mung beans, green gram, or kidney beans?’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, thokaṁ thokaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ, pasataṁ pasataṁ, yadi vā muggayūsaṁ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṁ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṁ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsaṁ.🔽Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, thokaṁ thokaṁ āhāraṁ āhārayato, pasataṁ pasataṁ, yadi
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana thokam thokam āhāram āhāresi pasatam pasata yadi vā mugga yūsa yadi vā kulattha yūsa yadi vā kaḷāya yūsa yadi vā hareṇuka yūsa  tassa aggivessana thokam thokam āhāram āhārayataḥ pasatam pasata yadi
translated: I ate a little food, a little bean soup, a little vetch soup, a little pea soup, a little lentil soup.

original: vā muggayūsaṁ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṁ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṁ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsaṁ,
analyzed: vā mugga yūsa yadi vā kulattha yūsa yadi vā kaḷāya yūsa yadi vā hareṇuka yūsa
translated: As I ate so little food,

original: adhimattakasimānaṁ patto kāyo hoti.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā; evamevassu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāyevappāhāratāya.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma oṭṭhapadaṁ; evamevassu me ānisadaṁ hoti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: adhimatta kasimānam patto kāyaḥ hoti  seyyathā api nāma āsītika pabbāni vā kāḷa pabbāni vā evam evassu me aṅga paccaṅgāni bhavanti tāya iva pāhāra tāya  seyyathā api nāma oṭṭhapade evam evassu me ānisadam hoti
translated: my limbs became extremely emaciated.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma vaṭṭanāvaḷī; evamevassu me piṭṭhikaṇṭako uṇṇatāvanato hoti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma vaṭṭanā vaḷī evam evassu me piṭṭhikaṇṭakaḥ uṇṇa tā avanataḥ hoti tāya iva pāhāra tāya
translated: Because of eating so little my limbs became like the joints of an eighty-year-old or more, and my buttocks became like a buffalo’s hoof, and my spine stood out like a hemp rope, and my ribs jutted out like the crazy rafters of an old, dilapidated barn, and my eyes sank deep in their sockets like the stars Dhaniṭṭhā and Uttara, and my scalp withered and dried out like a bitter bitter gourd shriveled for lack of water, and my body hair fell out as I pulled it out by the roots or it fell out when touched like the bark of the simsapa tree when the core is eaten.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma jarasālāya gopānasiyo oluggaviluggā bhavanti; evamevassu me phāsuḷiyo oluggaviluggā bhavanti tāyevappāhāratāya.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma gambhīre udapāne udakatārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti; evamevassu me akkhikūpesu akkhitārakā gambhīragatā okkhāyikā dissanti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma jarasālāya gopānasiyaḥ olugga viluggāḥ bhavanti evam evassu me phāsuḷiyaḥ olugga viluggāḥ bhavanti tāya iva ppāhāra tāya  seyyathā api nāma gambhīre udapāne udaka tārakāḥ gambhīra gatāḥ okkhāyikāḥ dissanti evam evassu me akkhi kūpesu akkhi tārakāḥ gambhīra gatāḥ okkhāyikāḥ dissanti tāyeva ppāhāra tāya
translated: Just as in an old building the beams on the inside and the rafters on the top-floor level are exposed, so too, my ribs were exposed.🔽Just as in a deep pool of water the stars in the sky appear reflected upside-down and distorted, so too, in the sockets of my eyes the pupils appeared upside-down and distorted.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma tittakālābu āmakacchinno vātātapena samphuṭito hoti sammilāto; evamevassu me sīsacchavi samphuṭitā hoti sammilātā tāyevappāhāratāya.🔽So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, udaracchaviṁ parimasissāmīti piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṁyeva pariggaṇhāmi,
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma tittaka alābu āmaka chinnaḥ vāta ātapena samphuṭitaḥ hoti sammilātaḥ evam evassu me sīsa chavi samphuṭitā hoti sammilātā tāya evappa āhāra tāya  saḥ kho aha aggivessana udara chavim parimasissāmi iti piṭṭhikaṇṭakayā iva pariggaṇhāmi
translated: Just as a bitter gourd is bitter both outside and inside, so too, my bile and phlegm were bitter.🔽When I tried to touch my belly, I grasped at my backbone.

original: piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṁ parimasissāmīti udaracchaviṁyeva pariggaṇhāmi, yāvassu me, aggivessana,
analyzed: piṭṭhikaṇṭakam parimasissāmi iti udara chaviyā iva pariggaṇhāmi yāvassu me aggivessana
translated: When I tried to touch my backbone, I grasped at my belly.

original: udaracchavi piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṁ allīnā hoti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: udara chavi piṭṭhikaṇṭakam allīnā hoti tāyevappāhāra tāya
translated: My belly and my backbone had shrunk away from each other.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, vaccaṁ vā muttaṁ vā karissāmīti tattheva avakujjo papatāmi tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana vaccam vā muttam vā karissāmi iti tattha iva avakujjaḥ papatāmi
translated: I thought: ‘If I urinate or defecate, I shall fall right over.’ Because of eating so little my body became extremely emaciated.🔽My limbs became like the jointed segments of vine stems or bamboo stems.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, imameva kāyaṁ assāsento pāṇinā gattāni anumajjāmi. Tassa
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana imam eva kāyam assāsentaḥ pāṇinā gattāni anumajjāmi tassa
translated: My buttocks became like a camel’s hoof.🔽My spine stood out like a string of beads.🔽My ribs jutted out like the broken rafters of an old, dilapidated barn.

original: mayhaṁ, aggivessana, pāṇinā gattāni anumajjato pūtimūlāni lomāni kāyasmā papatanti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: mayha aggivessana pāṇinā gattāni anumajjato pūti mūlāni lomāni kāyasmā papatanti
translated: My eyes sank deep in their sockets like the eyes of a big, purple-hued carp.🔽My scalp shriveled and withered like a green bitter gourd, shriveled and withered in the wind and sun.

original: Apissu maṁ, aggivessana, manussā disvā evamāhaṁsu: ‘kāḷo samaṇo gotamo’ti.🔽Ekacce manussā evamāhaṁsu: ‘na kāḷo samaṇo gotamo, sāmo samaṇo gotamo’ti.
analyzed: api ma aggivessana manussāḥ disvā kāḷaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti  ekacce manussāḥ evam āhasu na kāḷaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sāmaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti
translated: Some people, on seeing me, said: ‘The ascetic Gotama is black.’🔽Some said: ‘The ascetic Gotama is not black, he is brown.’

original: Ekacce manussā evamāhaṁsu: ‘na kāḷo samaṇo gotamo, napi sāmo, maṅguracchavi samaṇo gotamo’ti.🔽Yāvassu me, aggivessana, tāva parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto upahato hoti tāyevappāhāratāya.
analyzed: ekacce manussāḥ evam āhasu na kāḷaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sāmaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ iti  me aggivessana tāva parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇo pariyodāto upahataḥ hoti tāya iva pāhāra tāya
translated: Some said: ‘The ascetic Gotama is not black or brown, he has a golden complexion.’🔽My skin became so clear that it let light pass through it, so that at one time a naked ascetic said to me: ‘Good Gotama, your skin is so clear that it lets light pass through it.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: I thought:

original: ‘ye kho keci atītamaddhānaṁ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayiṁsu, etāvaparamaṁ, nayito bhiyyo.🔽Yepi hi keci anāgatamaddhānaṁ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayissanti, etāvaparamaṁ, nayito bhiyyo.
analyzed: ye kho keci atīta maddhānam samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayisu etau aparama nayitaḥ bhiyyas  ye api hi keci anāgata maddhānam samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanāḥ vedayissanti etau aparama nayitaḥ bhiyyas
translated: ‘Whatever ascetics and priests in the past experienced painful, sharp, harsh, and bitter feelings as a result of their austerities, these were the worst, there were none worse than these.🔽Whatever ascetics and priests in the future will experience painful, sharp, harsh, and bitter feelings as a result of their austerities, these will be the worst, there will be none worse than these.

original: Yepi hi keci etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti, etāvaparamaṁ, nayito bhiyyo.
analyzed: ye api hi keci etarahi samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanāḥ vedayanti etau aparama nayitaḥ bhiyyas
translated: Whatever ascetics and priests at present experience painful, sharp, harsh, and bitter feelings as a result of their austerities, these are the worst, there are none worse than these.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ imāya kaṭukāya dukkarakārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana aham imāya kaṭukāya dukkara kārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussa dhammā alam ariya ñāṇa dassana visesa
translated: But I have not attained any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones by this painful practice.

original: Siyā nu kho añño maggo bodhāyā’ti?
analyzed: siyā nu kho aññaḥ maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: Could there be another path to enlightenment?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: Then, Aggivessana, I considered this:

original: ‘abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicceva
analyzed: abhijānāmi kho pana aham pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinnaḥ vivicca iva
translated: ‘I recall that while my father the Sakyan was working, I sat in the cool shade of a rose-apple tree, secluded,

original: kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ
analyzed: kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham
translated: quite secluded from sense desires, secluded from unwholesome things, he entered upon and abided in the first jhāna, which is with thinking and pondering, born of seclusion, filled with delight and joy,

original: jhānaṁ upasampajja viharitā.
analyzed: jhānam upasampajja viharitā
translated: I entered and dwelled in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought and evaluation.

original: Siyā nu kho eso maggo bodhāyā’ti?
analyzed: siyā nu kho eso maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: ‘Is this the path to awakening?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, satānusāri viññāṇaṁ ahosi:
analyzed: tassa aggivessana sata anusāri viññāṇam ahosi
translated: I had the recollection that

original: ‘eseva maggo bodhāyā’ti.
analyzed: esa iva maggaḥ bodhāya ati
translated: ‘this is the path to awakening.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: Then, Aggivessana, I considered this:

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘Why am I afraid of that pleasure which is other than worldly pleasures, other than unwholesome states?’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: Then, Aggivessana, I considered this:

original: ‘na kho ahaṁ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṁ taṁ sukhaṁ aññatreva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
analyzed: na kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi yam tam sukham aññatra iva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: ‘I am not afraid of that pleasure which is other than worldly pleasures, other than unwholesome states.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, aggivessana, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa mayha aggivessana etat ahosi
translated: Then, Aggivessana, I considered this:

original: ‘na kho taṁ sukaraṁ sukhaṁ adhigantuṁ evaṁ adhimattakasimānaṁ pattakāyena, yannūnāhaṁ oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāreyyaṁ odanakummāsan’ti.
analyzed: na kho tam sukaram sukham adhigantum evam adhimattaka simānam patta kāyena yat nūna aham oḷārikam āhāram āhāreyyam odana kummā asanti
translated: ‘It is not easy to attain that pleasure with a body so excessively emaciated. Let me now take some coarse food, such as rice and porridge.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana oḷārikam āhāram āhāresiṃ odana kummāsa
translated: I took coarse food, rice and porridge.

original: Tena kho pana maṁ, aggivessana, samayena pañca bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitā honti:
analyzed: tena kho pana ma aggivessana samayena pañca bhikkhū paccupaṭṭhitāḥ honti
translated: At that time five monks were attending on me, thinking:

original: ‘yaṁ kho samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ adhigamissati, taṁ no ārocessatī’ti.
analyzed: yam kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam adhigamissati tam naḥ ārocessati iti
translated: ‘Whatever state the recluse Gotama will attain, we will declare ourselves to be his disciples.’

original: Yato kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāresiṁ odanakummāsaṁ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṁsu:
analyzed: yatas kho aha aggivessana oḷārikam āhāram āhāresiṃ odana kummāsa atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamisu
translated: But when I took coarse food, rice and porridge, those five monks left me, thinking:

original: ‘bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā’ti.🔽So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṁ āhāraṁ āhāretvā, balaṁ gahetvā, vivicceva kāmehi🔽vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ
analyzed: bāhullikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ padhāna vibbhantaḥ āvattaḥ bāhullāya ati  saḥ kho aha aggivessana oḷārikam āhāram āhāretvā balam gahetvā vivicca iva kāmehi  vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhāna
translated: ‘The recluse Gotama is now leading a life of luxury. He has given up striving and reverted to luxury.’🔽When I had taken coarse food, rice and porridge, and had regained strength,🔽quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I entered and dwelled in the first jhāna,

original: upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: upasampajja vihāsi
translated: which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: Such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the stilling of applied and sustained thought, I entered and remained in the second jhāna, which has internal confidence and unification of mind, is without applied thought, is filled with rapture and joy, and is born of concentration.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsiṁ, sato ca sampajāno. Sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedesiṁ
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsi sato ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedesi
translated: Such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the fading away of rapture, I remained equanimous, and mindful and clearly aware, I experienced happiness with the body; I entered and remained in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: Such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā, adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, I entered and remained in the fourth jhāna, which is neither painful nor pleasant and includes the purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: But such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: saḥ aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi jātim pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: I recollected my manifold past lives, i.e., one birth, two births, three births, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, many aeons of cosmic contraction, many aeons of cosmic expansion, many aeons of cosmic contraction and expansion, ‘There I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity to pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity to pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus I remembered my manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, aggivessana, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā;
analyzed: ayam kho me aggivessana rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the first knowledge I attained in the first watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose—as happens in one who is heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: But such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi …pe…
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi pe
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: ayaṁ kho me, aggivessana, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā;🔽avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: ayam kho me aggivessana rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā  avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: This was the second true knowledge attained by me in the last watch of the night.🔽As long as I did not know and see thus, I did not claim to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with its devas, Mara, and Brahma, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans.🔽But when I knew and saw thus, then I claimed to have awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in this world with…

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: Such pleasant feeling that arose in me did not invade my mind and remain.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.🔽‘Ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,
analyzed: abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam  ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘These are the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw thus, my mind was liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: And with liberation, there was the knowledge, ‘Liberated is my mind.’

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Ayaṁ kho me, aggivessana, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā;
analyzed: ayam kho me aggivessana rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the third true insight, which I attained in the last part of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno; yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose — as happens in one who is heedful, ardent, & resolute.

original: Evarūpāpi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṁ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: evarūpā api kho me aggivessana uppannā sukhā vedanā cittam na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati
translated: Such pleasant feeling arose in me, but it did not invade my mind.

original: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ, aggivessana, anekasatāya parisāya dhammaṁ desetā.🔽Apissu maṁ ekameko evaṁ maññati:
analyzed: abhijānāmi kho pana aha aggivessana aneka satāya parisāya dhammam desetā  mam ekam ekaḥ evam maññati
translated: I recall having taught the Dhamma to an assembly of many hundreds.

original: ‘mamevārabbha samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ desetī’ti.
analyzed: mama eva ārabbha samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam deseti iti
translated: And each one of them thought, ‘The Tathāgata is teaching me the Dhamma.’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, aggivessana, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ;
analyzed: na kho pana ita aggivessana evam daṭṭhabba
translated: But that, Aggivessana, is not the way to see it.

original: yāvadeva viññāpanatthāya tathāgato paresaṁ dhammaṁ deseti.
analyzed: yāvat eva viññāpana tthāya tathāgataḥ paresam dhammaṃ deseti
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the Dhamma to others only for the sake of intimation.

original: So kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, tassāyeva kathāya pariyosāne, tasmiṁyeva purimasmiṁ samādhinimitte
analyzed: saḥ kho aha aggivessana tassāya iva kathāya pariyosāne tasmiya eva purimasmim samādhi nimitte
translated: At the conclusion of that discourse, right there in that same concentration,

original: ajjhattameva cittaṁ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṁ karomi samādahāmi, yena sudaṁ niccakappaṁ viharāmī”ti.
analyzed: ajjhattam eva cittam saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodim karomi samādahāmi yena sudam nicca kappam viharāmi iti
translated: I focused my mind internally, settled it, unified it, and concentrated it. And I have lived ever since in that state.”

original: “Okappaniyametaṁ bhoto gotamassa yathā taṁ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: okappa niyam etam bhoto gotamassa yathā tam arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: “It is to be expected, Master Gotama, that Master Gotama would say this, for this is the kind of answer that Master Gotama would give.

original: Abhijānāti kho pana bhavaṁ gotamo divā supitā”ti?
analyzed: abhijānāti khalu pana bhavam gotamaḥ divā supitā ati
translated: But does Master Gotama admit to sleeping during the day?”

original: “Abhijānāmahaṁ, aggivessana, gimhānaṁ pacchime māse pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapetvā dakkhiṇena passena sato sampajāno niddaṁ okkamitā”ti.
analyzed: abhijānāmaha aggivessana gimhānam pacchime māse pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkanto catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññapetvā dakkhiṇena passena sataḥ sampajānaḥ niddam okkamitā ti
translated: “Aggivessana, I admit to sleeping during the day. In the last month of the hot season, after my meal, I return from my alms round, fold my upper robe in four, and lie down on my right side. I fall asleep and wake up thinking, ‘It is too soon to get up.’“

original: “Etaṁ kho, bho gotama, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammohavihārasmiṁ vadantī”ti?
analyzed: etam khalu bho gotama eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ sammoha vihārasmin vadanti iti
translated: “Master Gotama, some contemplatives & brahmans say this: ‘Those who are dismissed from the presence of Master Gotama say thus of him: “Master Gotama is one who sleeps during the day.”‘“

original: “Na kho, aggivessana, ettāvatā sammūḷho vā hoti asammūḷho vā.
analyzed: na kho aggivessanaḥ ettāvatā sammūḷhaḥ vā hoti a sammūḍhaḥ vā
translated: “Aggivessana, it’s not by this that one is confused or not confused.

original: Api ca, aggivessana, yathā sammūḷho ca hoti asammūḷho ca,
analyzed: api ca aggivessana yathā sammūḍhaḥ ca hoti asammūḍhaḥ ca
translated: But, Aggivessana, as to how one is confused and not confused,

original: taṁ suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Saccaka replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Yassa kassaci, aggivessana, ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇiyā appahīnā, tamahaṁ ‘sammūḷho’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kassaci aggivessana ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkha vipākā āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyā appahīnā tam aham sammūḷhaḥ iti vadāmi
translated: “Aggivessana, I say that anyone who hasn’t given up the defilements that defile, lead to renewed existence, bring trouble, and result in suffering and future birth, old age, and death, is confused.

original: Āsavānañhi, aggivessana, appahānā sammūḷho hoti.
analyzed: āsavānam hi aggivessana appahānā sammūḷhaḥ hoti
translated: Because without giving up the defilements one is confused.

original: Yassa kassaci, aggivessana, ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇiyā pahīnā, tamahaṁ ‘asammūḷho’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kassaci aggivessana ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkha vipākā āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyā pahīnā tam aham asammūḍhaḥ iti vadāmi
translated: I say that anyone who has given up the defilements that defile, lead to renewed existence, bring trouble, and result in suffering and future birth, old age, and death, is not confused.

original: Āsavānañhi, aggivessana, pahānā asammūḷho hoti.
analyzed: āsavānam hi aggivessana pahānā asammūḍhaḥ hoti
translated: Because by giving up the defilements one is not confused.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, aggivessana, ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇiyā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho aggivessana ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkha vipākā āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyā pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: Aggivessana, the defilements that defile, lead to renewed existence, bring trouble, and result in suffering and future birth, old age, and death, have been given up by the Realized One, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

original: Seyyathāpi, aggivessana, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna virūḷhiyā;
analyzed: seyyathā api aggivessana tālaḥ matthaka chinnaḥ abhabbaḥ puna virūḷhiyā
translated: Just as a palm tree with its top cut off is incapable of growing again,🔽so too, Aggivessana, the Tathagata has abandoned, expelled,

original: evameva kho, aggivessana, tathāgatassa ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā
analyzed: evam eva kho aggivessana tathāgatassa ye āsavā saṅkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkha vipākā
translated: and ejected the taints that defile, bring renewal of being, give trouble, ripen in suffering, and lead to future birth, ageing, and death;

original: āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇiyā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā”ti.
analyzed: āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyā pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā ati
translated: he has cut them off at the root … so that they are no longer subject to future arising.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha said to the Blessed One:

original: “acchariyaṁ, bho gotama, abbhutaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: acchariya bho gotama abbhuta bho gotama
translated: “It is wonderful, Master Gotama, it is marvellous!

original: Yāvañcidaṁ bhoto gotamassa evaṁ āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa, upanītehi vacanappathehi
analyzed: yāvañcidam bhoto gotamassa evam āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa upanītehi vacana ppathehi
translated: That Master Gotama should be so patient and gentle even when harshly spoken to,

original: samudācariyamānassa, chavivaṇṇo ceva pariyodāyati, mukhavaṇṇo ca vippasīdati, yathā🔽taṁ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: samudācariyamānassa chavi vaṇṇaḥ ca iva pariyodāyati mukha vaṇṇaḥ ca vippasīdati yathā  tam arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: when abused, when reproached, when given a bad name, is a wonderful and marvellous thing.

original: Abhijānāmahaṁ, bho gotama, pūraṇaṁ kassapaṁ vādena vādaṁ samārabhitā.
analyzed: abhijānāmaha bho gotama pūraṇam kassapam vādena vādam samārabhitā
translated: I admit, Master Gotama, that I challenged Purana Kassapa to debate,

original: Sopi mayā vādena vādaṁ samāraddho aññenaññaṁ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmesi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātvākāsi.
analyzed: saḥ api mayā vādena vādam samāraddhaḥ aññena aññam paṭicari bahiddhā katham apanāmesi kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātvā akāsi
translated: He too, when engaged in debate with me, evaded the question, went around the question, and did not give an answer.

original: Bhoto pana gotamassa evaṁ āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa, upanītehi vacanappathehi samudācariyamānassa,
analyzed: bhoto pana gotamassa evam āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa upanītehi vacana pathehi samudācariyamānassa
translated: But when you, Master Gotama, were pressed and size up,

original: chavivaṇṇo ceva pariyodāyati, mukhavaṇṇo ca vippasīdati, yathā taṁ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: chavi vaṇṇaḥ ca iva pariyodāyati mukha vaṇṇaḥ ca vippasīdati yathā tam arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: your complexion is clear and bright, your face is very bright, as is usual for one who is perfected and fully enlightened.

original: Abhijānāmahaṁ, bho gotama, makkhaliṁ gosālaṁ …pe…
analyzed: abhijānāmaha bho gotama makkhalim gosālam pe
translated: I recall having engaged Makkhali Gosāla …

original: ajitaṁ kesakambalaṁ …🔽pakudhaṁ kaccāyanaṁ …
analyzed: ajitam kesa kambalam  pakudham kaccāyanam
translated: Ajita Kesakambala …🔽Pakudha Kaccāyana …

original: sañjayaṁ belaṭṭhaputtaṁ …
analyzed: sañjayam belaṭṭha puttam
translated: Sañjaya Belaṭṭhiputta …

original: nigaṇṭhaṁ nāṭaputtaṁ vādena vādaṁ samārabhitā.
analyzed: nigaṇṭham nāṭa puttam vādena vādam samārabhitā
translated: and Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta in debate.

original: Sopi mayā vādena vādaṁ samāraddho aññenaññaṁ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmesi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātvākāsi.
analyzed: saḥ api mayā vādena vādam samāraddhaḥ aññena aññam paṭicari bahiddhā katham apanāmesi kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātvā akāsi
translated: They too, when engaged in debate with me, evaded the question, went around the question, and did not give an answer.

original: Bhoto pana gotamassa evaṁ āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa, upanītehi vacanappathehi samudācariyamānassa,
analyzed: bhoto pana gotamassa evam āsajja āsajja vuccamānassa upanītehi vacana pathehi samudācariyamānassa
translated: But when you spoke to the Buddha like this, pressing him with your words,

original: chavivaṇṇo ceva pariyodāyati, mukhavaṇṇo ca vippasīdati, yathā taṁ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: chavi vaṇṇaḥ ca iva pariyodāyati mukha vaṇṇaḥ ca vippasīdati yathā tam arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: his complexion became even more clear and bright, his face even more radiant, just as in an ascetic perfected and fully awakened.

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bho gotama, gacchāma.
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bho gotama gacchāma
translated: Now, then, we should go, Gotama.

original: Bahukiccā mayaṁ, bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kiccā maya bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: We have many duties, we have much to do.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, aggivessana, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.🔽Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva aggivessana kālam maññasi iti  atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi iti
translated: “Now is the time for you to do as you think fit.”🔽Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha, having delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words, rose from his seat and departed.

original: Mahāsaccakasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: mahāsaccaka suttam niṭṭhitam chaṭṭha
translated: The Long Discourses with Saccaka are finished.
